caption:
We're still looking to fill a few more spots on the Huntington Bank Red Patrol for the upcoming 2017-18 season!

As a member of the Huntington Bank Red Patrol, you will play a critical role in creating unforgettable experiences at #RedWings home games during the Inaugural Season at Little Caesars Arena. Team members assist in the coordination and execution of in-game elements, entertain and engage fans with a high level of enthusiasm and much more. In addition to game day responsibilities, the Huntington Bank Red Patrol also assists at numerous events in the community throughout the year.

Applicants must demonstrate an enthusiastic personality, willingness to engage a crowd and a strong work ethic. In addition, applicants should have a familiarity with the game of hockey and be knowledgeable of the #RedWings, past and present. If you re interested, please send a submission package to RedPatrolSearch@Gmail.com no later than Monday, July 31st. Submissions should include the following:
  Resume & applicable references
  Video bio showing why you would be a great member of the Huntington Bank Red Patrol (Unlisted/Private YouTube or Vimeo link)
  Portrait headshot

Please email all questions regarding the Huntington Bank Red Patrol Search to RedPatrolSearch@Gmail.com. | #lgrw

Team members assist in the coordination and execution of in-game elements, entertain and engage fans with a high level of enthusiasm and much more. In addition to game day responsibilities, the Huntington Bank Red Patrol also assists at numerous events in the community throughout the year.

Applicants must demonstrate an enthusiastic personality, willingness to engage a crowd and a strong work ethic. In addition, applicants should have a familiarity with the game of hockey and be knowledgeable of the #RedWings, past and present. If you’re interested, please send a submission package to RedPatrolSearch@Gmail.com no later than Monday, July 31st. Submissions should include the following:

caption:
The Detroit #RedWings are looking to find fun and enthusiastic individuals (18+) to join the Huntington Bank Red Patrol for the upcoming 2017-18 season. As a member of the Huntington Bank Red Patrol, you will play a critical role in creating unforgettable experiences at Red Wings home games during the Inaugural Season at Little Caesars Arena. Team members assist in the coordination and execution of in-game elements, entertain and engage fans with a high level of enthusiasm and much more. In addition to game day responsibilities, the Huntington Bank Red Patrol also assists at numerous events in the community throughout the year.

Applicants must demonstrate an enthusiastic personality, willingness to engage a crowd and a strong work ethic. In addition, applicants should have a familiarity with the game of hockey and be knowledgeable of the Red Wings, past and present.

If you re interested, please send a submission package to RedPatrolSearch@Gmail.com no later than Monday, June 26. Submissions should include the following:   Resume & applicable references
  Video bio showing why you would be a great member of the Huntington Bank Red Patrol (Unlisted/Private YouTube or Vimeo link)
  Portrait headshot

Please email all questions regarding the Huntington Bank Red Patrol Search to RedPatrolSearch@Gmail.com.

In conjunction with NHL Recycle the Game initiative as part of NHL Green  Week, the Red Wings will host a collection drive outside The Joe on the street level of the Joe Louis Arena People Mover Station (600 Civic Center Dr.) for fans to donate new or gently-used hockey equipment. caption: "I'm extremely saddened to hear news of the passing of Mr. Ilitch. Both Mr. and Mrs. Ilitch, as well as their entire family, have had an immeasurable impact on not only my career, but my life. "Going back to the age of 18 when I arrived in Detroit, the guidance, generosity, concern and love Mr. Ilitch had always shown me and my family are things I will forever be grateful for. "I was extremely fortunate to have played my entire career for a man who's love of hockey and burning desire to win were the catalysts which drove the Detroit Red Wings to four Stanley Cup Championships after his purchasing the team in 1982. "Mr. Ilitch has left an incredible legacy in baseball, hockey and Metropolitan Detroit. He will forever be remembered for all the ways he enriched our lives. Mike Ilitch will live on vividly in my mind and heart forever." - Steve Yzerman
caption_raw: "I'm extremely saddened to hear news of the passing of Mr. Ilitch. Both Mr. and Mrs. Ilitch, as well as their entire family, have had an immeasurable impact on not only my career, but my life. "Going back to the age of 18 when I arrived in Detroit, the guidance, generosity, concern and love Mr. Ilitch had always shown me and my family are things I will forever be grateful for. "I was extremely fortunate to have played my entire career for a man who's love of hockey and burning desire to win were the catalysts which drove the Detroit Red Wings to four Stanley Cup Championships after his purchasing the team in 1982. "Mr. Ilitch has left an incredible legacy in baseball, hockey and Metropolitan Detroit. He will forever be remembered for all the ways he enriched our lives. Mike Ilitch will live on vividly in my mind and heart forever." - Steve Yzerman

caption: "Mr. I stands as one of America's greatest sports team owners. To have been able to work with him for more than 30 years and be a part of turning a struggling franchise into a champion again was an experience of a lifetime. His commitment to his team and our fans, is the reason we all feel a part of  Hockeytown . He will be deeply missed by those of us who were fortunate enough to know him and call him a friend." - Ken Holland
caption_raw: "Mr. I stands as one of America's greatest sports team owners. To have been able to work with him for more than 30 years and be a part of turning a struggling franchise into a champion again was an experience of a lifetime. His commitment to his team and our fans, is the reason we all feel a part of “Hockeytown”. He will be deeply missed by those of us who were fortunate enough to know him and call him a friend." - Ken Holland

caption: Tonight's ceremonial puck drop featured Samantha Dye. At the age of 3, Samantha was diagnosed with Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia. After her diagnosis, Sam began a three-year treatment protocol which included chemotherapy and several inpatient stays at Children's Hospital of Michigan in Detroit. Following her initial treatment, Sam was declared in remission. Unfortunately, nearly one year later at the age of 7, Sam developed new symptoms that were identified as a relapse of her cancer. An avid Detroit Red Wings fan, Sam used the team as inspiration while battling through additional treatments. After years of treatments, Sam - who is now 15 years old - has been deemed cancer-free. | #wingsfightcancer #hockeyfightscancer #lgrw
caption_raw: Tonight's ceremonial puck drop featured Samantha Dye. At the age of 3, Samantha was diagnosed with Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia. After her diagnosis, Sam began a three-year treatment protocol which included chemotherapy and several inpatient stays at Children's Hospital of Michigan in Detroit. Following her initial treatment, Sam was declared in remission. Unfortunately, nearly one year later at the age of 7, Sam developed new symptoms that were identified as a relapse of her cancer. An avid Detroit Red Wings fan, Sam used the team as inspiration while battling through additional treatments. After years of treatments, Sam - who is now 15 years old - has been deemed cancer-free. | #wingsfightcancer #hockeyfightscancer #lgrw

caption:
APPLICATIONS DUE AT MIDNIGHT  

The Detroit #RedWings are looking to find fun and enthusiastic individuals to join the Red Patrol for the upcoming 2016-17 season. As a member of the Red Patrol, you play a critical role in creating unforgettable experiences at #RedWings home games. Team members assist in the coordination and execution of in-game elements, entertain and engage fans with a high level of enthusiasm, and much more. In addition to game day responsibilities, the Red Patrol also assists at numerous events in the community throughout the year.

Applicants much demonstrate an enthusiastic personality, willingness to engage a crowd, and a strong work ethic. In addition, applicants should have a familiarity with the game of hockey and be knowledgeable of the Detroit #RedWings past and present.

If interested, please send your submission package to RedPatrolSearch@gmail.com no later than Friday, September 2nd. Submissions should include the following:   Resume & applicable references
  Video bio showing why you would be a great Red Patrol member (Unlisted/Private YouTube or Vimeo link)
  Portrait headshot
Please email all questions regarding the Red Patrol Search to RedPatrolSearch@gmail.com   #lgrw #farewell2thejoe
caption_raw:
🚨 APPLICATIONS DUE AT MIDNIGHT 🚨

The Detroit #RedWings are looking to find fun and enthusiastic individuals to join the Red Patrol for the upcoming 2016-17 season. As a member of the Red Patrol, you play a critical role in creating unforgettable experiences at #RedWings home games. Team members assist in the coordination and execution of in-game elements, entertain and engage fans with a high level of enthusiasm, and much more. In addition to game day responsibilities, the Red Patrol also assists at numerous events in the community throughout the year.

Applicants much demonstrate an enthusiastic personality, willingness to engage a crowd, and a strong work ethic. In addition, applicants should have a familiarity with the game of hockey and be knowledgeable of the Detroit #RedWings past and present.

If interested, please send your submission package to RedPatrolSearch@gmail.com no later than Friday, September 2nd. Submissions should include the following: • Resume & applicable references
• Video bio showing why you would be a great Red Patrol member (Unlisted/Private YouTube or Vimeo link)
• Portrait headshot
Please email all questions regarding the Red Patrol Search to RedPatrolSearch@gmail.com • #lgrw #farewell2thejoe

caption: "When you re a kid and you look up to somebody and he becomes your hero and then your mentor, a lot of times kids get disappointed. For me when I met Gordie Howe I always remember telling my dad that he was bigger and better than I had ever imagined. He was genuinely a nice man and obviously the greatest player that ever played. So for me I was really lucky that my idol was as nice as he was." - Wayne Gretzky ( : SI Vault) | #9RIP
caption_raw: "When you’re a kid and you look up to somebody and he becomes your hero and then your mentor, a lot of times kids get disappointed. For me when I met Gordie Howe I always remember telling my dad that he was bigger and better than I had ever imagined. He was genuinely a nice man and obviously the greatest player that ever played. So for me I was really lucky that my idol was as nice as he was." - Wayne Gretzky (📸: SI Vault) | #9RIP

caption: "The list of hockey players who suited up in six different decades, including returning to the ice after being inducted into the Hall of Fame, is a short one: it starts and ends with Gordie Howe.  But the list of kids who skated around the pond until dark, picturing themselves passing, scoring, and enforcing like Howe, dreaming of hoisting the Stanley Cup like him   that one comprises too many to count.  Howe s productivity, perseverance, and humility personified his adopted hometown of Detroit, to which he brought four championships and which he represented as an All-Star more than 20 times. The greatest players define their game for a generation; over more than half a century on the ice, Mr. Hockey defined it for a lifetime. Michelle and I send our condolences to his sons and daughter, his family, and his loyal fans from Hockeytown to Hartford to Houston and across North America." - President Obama | #9RIP
caption_raw: "The list of hockey players who suited up in six different decades, including returning to the ice after being inducted into the Hall of Fame, is a short one: it starts and ends with Gordie Howe.  But the list of kids who skated around the pond until dark, picturing themselves passing, scoring, and enforcing like Howe, dreaming of hoisting the Stanley Cup like him – that one comprises too many to count.  Howe’s productivity, perseverance, and humility personified his adopted hometown of Detroit, to which he brought four championships and which he represented as an All-Star more than 20 times. The greatest players define their game for a generation; over more than half a century on the ice, Mr. Hockey defined it for a lifetime. Michelle and I send our condolences to his sons and daughter, his family, and his loyal fans from Hockeytown to Hartford to Houston and across North America." - President Obama | #9RIP

caption: I was very sad to learn today of the passing of my longtime teammate, and friend, Gordie Howe. Gordie really was the greatest hockey player who ever lived. I was fortunate to play with Gordie for 12 seasons with the Detroit Red Wings and I ve known him for over 70 years. He could do it all in the game to help his team, both offensively and defensively. He earned everything that he accomplished on the ice.  Beyond hockey, Colleen and his family meant everything to him. Gordie was larger than life, and he was someone who I thought would live forever. My wife Joanne and I extend our condolences to Gordie s children   Cathleen, Mark, Marty and Murray   and his entire family and many friends during this time.  - Ted Lindsay | #9RIP
caption_raw: “I was very sad to learn today of the passing of my longtime teammate, and friend, Gordie Howe. Gordie really was the greatest hockey player who ever lived. I was fortunate to play with Gordie for 12 seasons with the Detroit Red Wings and I’ve known him for over 70 years. He could do it all in the game to help his team, both offensively and defensively. He earned everything that he accomplished on the ice. “Beyond hockey, Colleen and his family meant everything to him. Gordie was larger than life, and he was someone who I thought would live forever. My wife Joanne and I extend our condolences to Gordie’s children — Cathleen, Mark, Marty and Murray — and his entire family and many friends during this time.” - Ted Lindsay | #9RIP

caption_raw: Thank you Mr. Hockey. #9RIP

caption: "It was very saddening to hear the news of Gordie's passing this morning. He has been an icon not only in Detroit, but throughout the entire hockey world for as long as I can remember. As one of the greatest players to ever play in the NHL, the majority of his career being in Detroit, it was an honor to wear the same uniform, spend time with, laugh, joke and seek advice from him. Gordie's humility and kindness left a permanent impression on me, greatly influencing how I tried to conduct myself throughout my career.  His impact on the Red Wings organization is still evident today. I travel the world and constantly hear stories from people who love the Wings and share memories of the glory days when Gordie and his teammates ruled the NHL. For all players fortunate enough to play for the Wings, we should take time to thank and honor Gordie, for he is a significant reason why Detroit is such a special place to play.  To Gordie's surviving family, I offer my sincere condolences, in particular to his son Mark, my former teammate and colleague, who cannot help but remind me of his father every time I see him." - Steve Yzerman (via: @tblightning) #9RIP
caption_raw: "It was very saddening to hear the news of Gordie's passing this morning. He has been an icon not only in Detroit, but throughout the entire hockey world for as long as I can remember. As one of the greatest players to ever play in the NHL, the majority of his career being in Detroit, it was an honor to wear the same uniform, spend time with, laugh, joke and seek advice from him. Gordie's humility and kindness left a permanent impression on me, greatly influencing how I tried to conduct myself throughout my career. “His impact on the Red Wings organization is still evident today. I travel the world and constantly hear stories from people who love the Wings and share memories of the glory days when Gordie and his teammates ruled the NHL. For all players fortunate enough to play for the Wings, we should take time to thank and honor Gordie, for he is a significant reason why Detroit is such a special place to play. “To Gordie's surviving family, I offer my sincere condolences, in particular to his son Mark, my former teammate and colleague, who cannot help but remind me of his father every time I see him." - Steve Yzerman (via: @tblightning) #9RIP

caption: Statement from the Howe family... "Hockey Legend Gordie Howe, age 88, passed away peacefully this morning with his family by his side. The Howe family would like to thank friends and fans for their love and support. Gordie had a special connection with Red Wings fans and was always touched by their commitment. We are celebrating the life of a devoted husband, father, grandfather, great-grandfather and a friend to all. Arrangements will be announced once they are finalized." | #9RIP
caption_raw: Statement from the Howe family... "Hockey Legend Gordie Howe, age 88, passed away peacefully this morning with his family by his side. The Howe family would like to thank friends and fans for their love and support. Gordie had a special connection with Red Wings fans and was always touched by their commitment. We are celebrating the life of a devoted husband, father, grandfather, great-grandfather and a friend to all. Arrangements will be announced once they are finalized." | #9RIP

caption: The first year I was here he came down into the locker room and introduced himself. It was pretty cool because I had never met him before, so to actually meet him in person, shake his hand and to finally meet Mr. Hockey was an unbelievable feeling.  - Henrik Zetterberg | #9RIP
caption_raw: “The first year I was here he came down into the locker room and introduced himself. It was pretty cool because I had never met him before, so to actually meet him in person, shake his hand and to finally meet Mr. Hockey was an unbelievable feeling.” - Henrik Zetterberg | #9RIP

caption: The Red Wings organization and the National Hockey League would not be what they are today without Gordie Howe. There is no nickname more fitting for him than  Mr. Hockey.  He embodied on and off the ice what it meant to be both a Red Wing and a Detroiter. He was tough, skilled, and consistently earned success at the highest level. His achievements are numerous and his accomplishments immeasurable. It is truly a blessing to have had him both in our organization and our city for so many years. He will be deeply missed.  - Mike Ilitch | #9RIP
caption_raw: “The Red Wings organization and the National Hockey League would not be what they are today without Gordie Howe. There is no nickname more fitting for him than “Mr. Hockey.” He embodied on and off the ice what it meant to be both a Red Wing and a Detroiter. He was tough, skilled, and consistently earned success at the highest level. His achievements are numerous and his accomplishments immeasurable. It is truly a blessing to have had him both in our organization and our city for so many years. He will be deeply missed.” - Mike Ilitch | #9RIP

Big thanks to all red wings fans for supporting us. You made us feel like we are playing home in every building in NHL.Next Season We will get ready and come stronger.

Ve k  v aka v etk m Redwings fan ikom. Boli ste  asn  . Aj napriek hos uj cim z pasom s va ou podporou sa c time ako doma. 
Priatelia, kamarati, Slovaci 
Je mi to ve mi  to, ale nem em sa z astni  na MS. Po absolvovan  nieko ko testov sa potvrdilo zranenie ramena. 
Urobil som pre  ast maximum. Chlapcom dr m palce urcite im budem fandi . 
#redwings #25 #lgrw #teamslovakia #worldchampionchip

Unfortunately I won't be playing for Team Slovakia on world championship. I have to recover upper body injury. 
Veľké vďaka všetkým Redwings fanúšikom. Boli ste úžasný . Aj napriek hosťujúcim zápasom s vašou podporou sa cítime ako doma. 
Priatelia, kamarati, Slovaci…
Je mi to veľmi ľúto, ale nemôžem sa zúčastniť na MS. Po absolvovaní niekoľko testov sa potvrdilo zranenie ramena. 
Urobil som pre účast maximum. Chlapcom držím palce urcite im budem fandiť.🇸🇰🇸🇰🇸🇰

#RedWings center Riley Sheahan recently took a trip to the Michigan Humane Society for a tour of their new Detroit Animal Care Campus. Through his charity program, Riley's Rescues, Riley donates $100 for every goal and assist he scores this season!

This month Riley is featuring Moxie, a 10 month old Bull Terrier mix. She is currently available for adoption at the Detroit location. The lucky person who adopts Moxie will receive a special Red Wings fan pack as a thank you for adopting a rescue pet. #IMTH #LGRW #RileysRescues

・・・
#RedWings center Riley Sheahan recently took a trip to the Michigan Humane Society for a tour of their new Detroit Animal Care Campus. Through his charity program, Riley's Rescues, Riley donates $100 for every goal and assist he scores this season!

This month Riley is featuring Moxie, a 10 month old Bull Terrier mix. She is currently available for adoption at the Detroit location. The lucky person who adopts Moxie will receive a special Red Wings fan pack as a thank you for adopting a rescue pet. #IMTH #LGRW #RileysRescues

caption:
#Repost @drwcommunity
 
#RedWings Center Riley Sheahan would like to thank Lillian S. of Detroit for adopting this month's featured pet, Roberta! Roberta is a five year old Mastiff mix from the Michigan Humane Society in Detroit. Lillian S. will receive a special Red Wings fan pack and autographed photo as a thank you for adopting a rescue pet.

Each month, Riley visits the Michigan Humane Society to hang out with their adoptable pets through his charity program, Riley's Rescues. Riley will also donate $100 for every goal and assist he scores this season! #IMTH

#Repost @drwcommunity
 
#RedWings Center Riley Sheahan recently visited the @mhumane Society in Detroit to hang out with some of their adoptable pets through his charity program, Riley's Rescues. Riley will donate $100 for every goal and assist he scores this season!

Today, Riley is featuring Sweet Potato (left) and Rocko (right). Sweet Potato is an 8 month old female and Rocko is a 3 year old male both currently available at the Detroit location. The lucky person who adopts Sweet Potato or Rocko will receive a #RedWings goody bag with a photo autographed by Riley as a thank you for adopting a rescue pet! #IMTH #

#RedWings Center Riley Sheahan recently visited the @mhumane Society in Detroit to hang out with some of their adoptable pets through his charity program, Riley's Rescues. Riley will donate $100 for every goal and assist he scores this season!

Today, Riley is featuring Sweet Potato (left) and Rocko (right). Sweet Potato is an 8 month old female and Rocko is a 3 year old male both currently available at the Detroit location. The lucky person who adopts Sweet Potato or Rocko will receive a #RedWings goody bag with a photo autographed by Riley as a thank you for adopting a rescue pet! #IMTH #🐶

caption:
As construction continues to progress on the new Detroit Events Center, @olympiaentertainment is excited to announce plans for significant fan and community enhancements to the facility.

The new Detroit arena will feature unique gondola seating, a vibrant public plaza with a massive video wall, practice and amateur hockey ice rinks, additional video and sound capabilities, and much more!

http://redwings.nhl.com/club/news.htm?id=786180

As construction continues to progress on the new Detroit Events Center, @olympiaentertainment is excited to announce plans for significant fan and community enhancements to the facility.

The new Detroit arena will feature unique gondola seating, a vibrant public plaza with a massive video wall, practice and amateur hockey ice rinks, additional video and sound capabilities, and much more!

http://redwings.nhl.com/club/news.htm?id=786180

caption:
Center @rsheahan15 visits the Michigan Humane Society's Detroit location each month to feature one of their adoptable pets through his charity program Riley's Rescues. 
Today, Riley would like to feature Futo, a 10 year old male  Shih Tzu mix. If you would like to adopt this puppy, please go to the Detroit Center for Animal Care between 11 a.m. - 5 p.m. (Mon-Sat). The lucky person who adopts Futo will receive a #RedWings goody bag with a photo autographed by Riley in the mail as a thank you for adopting a rescue pet.

caption:
#Repost @drwcommunity.
 
While the 2015 King Clancy Memorial Trophy was awarded to @detroitredwings captain Henrik Zetterberg tonight, we want to be sure to congratulate his wife Emma on the honor as well. The two of them work tirelessly in the Metro Detroit community as well as overseas in Kemba, Ethiopia. Their Water Project in Kemba will finish this December and provide 3,000 people of the village with clean, drinkable water for life! 
Thanks to their efforts abroad and here in the Detroit area, we are happy to celebrate this award with Henrik and Emma. Thank you both for providing fun opportunities for countless kids, including @makewishmi kid Emily who got to pick out a ball gown with Emma and then come to a game with her family in the @zetterbergfoundation suite this season! #IMTH #NHLAwards
caption_raw:
#Repost @drwcommunity.
・・・
While the 2015 King Clancy Memorial Trophy was awarded to @detroitredwings captain Henrik Zetterberg tonight, we want to be sure to congratulate his wife Emma on the honor as well. The two of them work tirelessly in the Metro Detroit community as well as overseas in Kemba, Ethiopia. Their Water Project in Kemba will finish this December and provide 3,000 people of the village with clean, drinkable water for life! 
Thanks to their efforts abroad and here in the Detroit area, we are happy to celebrate this award with Henrik and Emma. Thank you both for providing fun opportunities for countless kids, including @makewishmi kid Emily who got to pick out a ball gown with Emma and then come to a game with her family in the @zetterbergfoundation suite this season! #IMTH #NHLAwards

caption: Congratulations, Henrik Zetterberg, on being awarded the 2015 King Clancy Memorial Trophy! The King Clancy award is given to the player who best exemplifies leadership qualities on and off the ice and has made a noteworthy humanitarian contribution in his community. #NHLAwards #zetterberg

caption:
A message from another #RedWings legend, Ted Lindsay.  I would like to wish Mr. Hockey, Gordie Howe, the greatest hockey player to ever play the game, a very Happy 87th Birthday.  No one to this day can play the game with the same combination of toughness and skill that Gordie displayed for 25 years in a Red Wings uniform.  He was a great teammate and I m thrilled at the progress he s made in his recovery.  I wish him all the best as he continues his battle.  Happy Birthday, Gordie!  -  Ted Lindsay, Mar. 31, 2015
#MrHockey #GordieHowe #LGRW
caption_raw:
A message from another #RedWings legend, Ted Lindsay. “I would like to wish Mr. Hockey, Gordie Howe, the greatest hockey player to ever play the game, a very Happy 87th Birthday.  No one to this day can play the game with the same combination of toughness and skill that Gordie displayed for 25 years in a Red Wings uniform.  He was a great teammate and I’m thrilled at the progress he’s made in his recovery.  I wish him all the best as he continues his battle.  Happy Birthday, Gordie!” - ​​​​​​​​Ted Lindsay, Mar. 31, 2015

caption:
Meet our newest forward, Erik Cole, the #RedWings acquired Cole from Dallas with a conditional third-round selection in the 2015 NHL Entry Draft in exchange for center Mattias Janmark, defenseman Mattias Backman and a second-round pick in the 2015 NHL Entry Draft.

Cole, 36, has skated in 57 games for Dallas this season, ranking third on the club in goals (18) and fourth in points (33) in addition to a team-best plus-four rating. The 6-foot-2, 205-lb., forward has skated in 881 games for the Carolina Hurricanes, Edmonton Oilers, Montreal Canadiens and Stars during his 13-season NHL career, totaling 526 points (262-264-526) and 659 penalty minutes. He has twice reached the 30-goal plateau, doing so most recently with a career-high 35 as a member of the Canadiens in 2011-12. Cole also matched his career-high point total that year with 61 (35-26-61), first set during the 2006-07 season with Carolina (29-32-61). Originally drafted by the Hurricanes in the third round (71st overall) of the 1998 NHL Entry Draft, Cole reached the Stanley Cup Finals on two occasions with Carolina, losing to Detroit in 2002 before helping the franchise to its first-ever championship in 2006. #LGRW
caption_raw:
Meet our newest forward, Erik Cole, the #RedWings acquired Cole from Dallas with a conditional third-round selection in the 2015 NHL Entry Draft in exchange for center Mattias Janmark, defenseman Mattias Backman and a second-round pick in the 2015 NHL Entry Draft.

Cole, 36, has skated in 57 games for Dallas this season, ranking third on the club in goals (18) and fourth in points (33) in addition to a team-best plus-four rating. The 6-foot-2, 205-lb., forward has skated in 881 games for the Carolina Hurricanes, Edmonton Oilers, Montreal Canadiens and Stars during his 13-season NHL career, totaling 526 points (262-264-526) and 659 penalty minutes. He has twice reached the 30-goal plateau, doing so most recently with a career-high 35 as a member of the Canadiens in 2011-12. Cole also matched his career-high point total that year with 61 (35-26-61), first set during the 2006-07 season with Carolina (29-32-61). Originally drafted by the Hurricanes in the third round (71st overall) of the 1998 NHL Entry Draft, Cole reached the Stanley Cup Finals on two occasions with Carolina, losing to Detroit in 2002 before helping the franchise to its first-ever championship in 2006. #LGRW

caption:
Meet our newest defenceman, Marek Zidlicky, from the New Jersey Devils who we traded for in exchange for a conditional third-round pick in the 2016 NHL Entry Draft.

Zidlicky, 38, lead all Devils defensemen and was tied for fifth overall in team scoring with 23 points (4-19-23) in 63 games this season. The 10-year NHL veteran has appeared in 762 NHL games with the Nashville Predators, Minnesota Wild and Devils since 2005-06, totaling 390 points (82-308-390) and 646 penalty minutes. The 5-foot-11, 190-lb., blueliner has cracked 40 points on six occasions during his career, including last season when he racked up 42 points (12-30-42) in 81 games with the Devils. He has also picked up nine points (1-8-9) in 38 career postseason games. #LGRW
caption_raw:
Meet our newest defenceman, Marek Zidlicky, from the New Jersey Devils who we traded for in exchange for a conditional third-round pick in the 2016 NHL Entry Draft.

Zidlicky, 38, lead all Devils defensemen and was tied for fifth overall in team scoring with 23 points (4-19-23) in 63 games this season. The 10-year NHL veteran has appeared in 762 NHL games with the Nashville Predators, Minnesota Wild and Devils since 2005-06, totaling 390 points (82-308-390) and 646 penalty minutes. The 5-foot-11, 190-lb., blueliner has cracked 40 points on six occasions during his career, including last season when he racked up 42 points (12-30-42) in 81 games with the Devils. He has also picked up nine points (1-8-9) in 38 career postseason games. #LGRW

caption:
Center Riley Sheahan will visit the Michigan Humane Society's Detroit location each month to feature one of their adoptable pets on our Facebook page through his charity program Riley's Rescues. In addition, Riley will donate $100 for every goal and assist he scores this season. 
Today, Riley would like to feature terrier cross mix Ben. If you would like to adopt this 10-year-old male dog, please go to the Detroit Center for Animal Care between 11 a.m. - 5 p.m. (Mon-Sat). The lucky person who adopts Ben will receive a Red Wings goody bag with a photo autographed by Riley in the mail as a thank you for adopting a rescue pet.
caption_raw:
Center Riley Sheahan will visit the Michigan Humane Society's Detroit location each month to feature one of their adoptable pets on our Facebook page through his charity program Riley's Rescues. In addition, Riley will donate $100 for every goal and assist he scores this season. 
Today, Riley would like to feature terrier cross mix Ben. If you would like to adopt this 10-year-old male dog, please go to the Detroit Center for Animal Care between 11 a.m. - 5 p.m. (Mon-Sat). The lucky person who adopts Ben will receive a Red Wings goody bag with a photo autographed by Riley in the mail as a thank you for adopting a rescue pet.

caption:
Congrats to @Trto90, who's been named the @NHL's Second Star of the week! 
Tatar shared first among all players with five goals and seven points, scoring in four straight games to propel the Red Wings (26-11-9, 61 points) to four consecutive victories. He began the week with one goal in each of his first two contests   a 3-1 win over the Buffalo Sabres Jan. 13 and a 3-2 overtime victory against the St. Louis Blues Jan. 15. Tatar then set a career high with three points (2-1-3), including the game-winning goal, in a 5-2 triumph over the Nashville Predators Jan. 17. He capped the week with 1-1-2, his seventh multi-point game of the season, in a 6-4 victory over the Buffalo Sabres Jan. 18. The 24-year-old Ilava, Slovakia, native shares seventh in the NHL and paces the Red Wings with 21 goals in 46 contests this season. He also is tied for third on the club with 34 points, including 9-3-12 in his past 12 appearances.

Congrats to @Trto90, who's been named the @NHL's Second Star of the week!

He began the week with one goal in each of his first two contests – a 3-1 win over the Buffalo Sabres Jan. 13 and a 3-2 overtime victory against the St. Louis Blues Jan. 15. Tatar then set a career high with three points (2-1-3), including the game-winning goal, in a 5-2 triumph over the Nashville Predators Jan. 17. He capped the week with 1-1-2, his seventh multi-point game of the season, in a 6-4 victory over the Buffalo Sabres Jan. 18. The 24-year-old Ilava, Slovakia, native shares seventh in the NHL and paces the Red Wings with 21 goals in 46 contests this season. He also is tied for third on the club with 34 points, including 9-3-12 in his past 12 appearances.

caption:
#Repost @drwcommunity 
Center @rsheahan15 visits the Michigan Humane Society's Detroit location each month to feature one of their adoptable pets on our Facebook page through his charity program Riley's Rescues. In addition, Riley will donate $100 for every goal and assist he scores this season. Today, Riley would like to feature two Yorkshire Terrier cross mixes. The lighter color Yorkie mix is seven-year-old Agatha, while the darker color Yorkie mix is three-year-old Mr. Jingle. If you would like to adopt either of these dogs, please go to the Detroit Center for Animal Care between 11 a.m. - 5 p.m. (Mon-Sat). The lucky person who adopts either Agatha or Mr. Jingle will receive a Red Wings goody bag with a photo autographed by Riley in the mail as a thank you for adopting a rescue pet. #IMTH
caption_raw:
#Repost @drwcommunity

The lighter color Yorkie mix is seven-year-old Agatha, while the darker color Yorkie mix is three-year-old Mr. Jingle. If you would like to adopt either of these dogs, please go to the Detroit Center for Animal Care between 11 a.m. - 5 p.m. (Mon-Sat). The lucky person who adopts either Agatha or Mr. Jingle will receive a Red Wings goody bag with a photo autographed by Riley in the mail as a thank you for adopting a rescue pet. #IMTH

Pav signing some autographs for the children at today's Adopt-A-Family Holiday Party. #IMTH 
Twelve Red Wings players adopted families through Volunteers of America Michigan and Children's Hospital of Michigan Foundation this season. The Red Wings hosted a holiday party for these families today so they could watch the team's practice and enjoy a pizza party before meeting the players and their significant others to receive their gifts.

caption: Niklas Kronwall and the #RedWings players rocked the 'Beads of Courage' today at practice. Each player had special red-and-white "Beads of Courage" pinned to their jerseys during today's practice that will be then given to patients at Children's Hospital of Michigan when they hit a special milestone like finishing a complete round of chemotherapy. Along with the beads, the child will receive an autograph card saying that a particular Red Wings player wore these pins during practice in their honor and congratulating them on their "Act of Courage." These beads will be added to a string of beads the child has already collected as they've gone through their treatment. #IMTH #LGRW

caption:
Hey guess what Hockeytown, @datsyuk13hockey is the @nhl's First Star of the week. Let's all take 15 seconds to appreciate the show he put on over the course of last week. #magicman ---
Datsyuk shared the League lead with seven points (3-4 7) in four games, including three multi-point performances, to help the Red Wings (17-6-5, 39 points) pick up a trio of victories and tie the Lightning (18-7-3, 39 points) for the most points in the Atlantic Division and Eastern Conference. He opened the week with 1-1 2 in a 4-3 loss to the Florida Panthers Dec. 2. Datsyuk then recorded his second consecutive 1-1 2 performance, including his 47th career game-winning goal, in a 5-2 victory over the Dallas Stars Dec. 4. After being held off the scoresheet in a 3-2 win over the New York Rangers Dec. 6, Datsyuk (1-2 3) factored on all three Red Wings goals, his second three-point game of the season, in a 3-1 triumph over the Carolina Hurricanes Dec. 7. The 36-year-old Sverdlovsk, Russia, native has recorded five multi-point performances in his last seven outings, totaling 7-4 11 in that stretch. Despite missing 11 games this season, Datsyuk is tied for first on the Red Wings with 12 goals and ranks second on the club with 22 points in 17 contests.

He opened the week with 1-1—2 in a 4-3 loss to the Florida Panthers Dec. 2. Datsyuk then recorded his second consecutive 1-1—2 performance, including his 47th career game-winning goal, in a 5-2 victory over the Dallas Stars Dec. 4. The 36-year-old Sverdlovsk, Russia, native has recorded five multi-point performances in his last seven outings, totaling 7-4—11 in that stretch. Despite missing 11 games this season, Datsyuk is tied for first on the Red Wings with 12 goals and ranks second on the club with 22 points in 17 contests.

caption:
Congratulations to Daniel Alfredsson on an incredibly successful career. You were a joy to watch and a class act on and off the ice, both in Detroit and Ottawa. On behalf of the Detroit Red Wings organization, we wish you nothing but the best for your future. "He always brings it, it seems like the more important the game the better he plays. Before he came here I only played him on national teams. But, last year for me was a special year to have a chance to play with him, his presence in the locker room, on the ice, he was one the best players and leaders we had" - Henrik Zetterberg
#Alfie #Sticktaps #Legend #LGRW

caption:
Congrats to @trto90 on being named the second star of the week by the @nhl! 
Tatar tied for second in the League with 4-1-5, including two game-winning goals, to lead the Red Wings (10-5-5, 25 points) to two victories in three starts. He opened the week with a pair of game-winning goals and multi-point performances: 1-1 2 in 5-0 triumph over the Columbus Blue Jackets Nov. 18 and 2-0-2 in a 4-3 victory over the Winnipeg Jets Nov. 20. Tatar then added his ninth goal of the season in a 4-1 loss to the Toronto Maple Leafs Nov. 22, stretching his point streak to a career-long five games (5-2-7). The 23-year-old Ilava, Slovakia, native has found the back of the net in three consecutive games for the second time in his NHL career (also Jan. 4-11, 2014: 3-1-4). He is tied for the team lead in goals this season and also is tied for fourth with 12 points (20 GP). #tats
caption_raw:
Congrats to @trto90 on being named the second star of the week by the @nhl! 
Tatar tied for second in the League with 4-1-5, including two game-winning goals, to lead the Red Wings (10-5-5, 25 points) to two victories in three starts. He opened the week with a pair of game-winning goals and multi-point performances: 1-1—2 in 5-0 triumph over the Columbus Blue Jackets Nov. 18 and 2-0-2 in a 4-3 victory over the Winnipeg Jets Nov. 20. Tatar then added his ninth goal of the season in a 4-1 loss to the Toronto Maple Leafs Nov. 22, stretching his point streak to a career-long five games (5-2-7). The 23-year-old Ilava, Slovakia, native has found the back of the net in three consecutive games for the second time in his NHL career (also Jan. 4-11, 2014: 3-1-4). He is tied for the team lead in goals this season and also is tied for fourth with 12 points (20 GP). #tats

caption:
Congratulations to @datsyuk13hockey on being named @nhl's second star of the week! #magicman #redwings --
Datsyuk (4-3 7) tied for the League lead with seven points in three games to help the Red Wings (6-2-3, 15 points) earn five out of a possible six standings points. He recorded multiple points in all three outings: 1-1 2 in a 4-2 victory over the Washington Capitals Oct. 29, 2-1 3 in a 5-2 win over the Los Angeles Kings Oct. 31 and 1-1 2 in a 3-2 shootout loss to the Buffalo Sabres Nov. 2. The 36-year-old Sverdlovsk, Russia, native has 5-5 10 in six total games since making his season debut Oct. 21, including at least one point in each contest   the longest season-opening point streak of his 13-season NHL career. His five goals and 10 points also are personal bests through the first six games of any season. A sixth-round selection (171st overall) by the Red Wings in the 1998 NHL Draft, Datsyuk has 277-537 814 in 830 career regular-season appearances.
caption_raw:
Congratulations to @datsyuk13hockey on being named @nhl's second star of the week! #magicman #redwings --
Datsyuk (4-3—7) tied for the League lead with seven points in three games to help the Red Wings (6-2-3, 15 points) earn five out of a possible six standings points. He recorded multiple points in all three outings: 1-1—2 in a 4-2 victory over the Washington Capitals Oct. 29, 2-1—3 in a 5-2 win over the Los Angeles Kings Oct. 31 and 1-1—2 in a 3-2 shootout loss to the Buffalo Sabres Nov. 2. The 36-year-old Sverdlovsk, Russia, native has 5-5—10 in six total games since making his season debut Oct. 21, including at least one point in each contest – the longest season-opening point streak of his 13-season NHL career. His five goals and 10 points also are personal bests through the first six games of any season. A sixth-round selection (171st overall) by the Red Wings in the 1998 NHL Draft, Datsyuk has 277-537—814 in 830 career regular-season appearances.

caption: #Repost from @drwcommunityWay to go Riley!--- Center @rsheahan15 will visit the Michigan Humane Society's Detroit location each month to feature one of their adoptable pets on our Facebook page through his new charity program Riley's Rescues. In addition, Riley will donate $100 for every goal and assist he scores this season. Today, we would like to feature the very adorable shepherd cross mix, Hector. If you would like to adopt this 8-week-old male puppy, please go to the Detroit Center for Animal Care between 11 a.m. - 5 p.m. (Mon-Sat). The lucky person who adopts this dog will receive a Red Wings goody bag with a photo autographed by Riley in the mail as a thank you for adopting a rescue pet. #IMTH

caption:
The Detroit Red Wings today announced that they have agreed to terms with defenseman Joe Hicketts (@joehicketts) on a three-year, entry-level contract. In accordance with club policy, additional details will not be disclosed.

Hicketts, 18, signs his first NHL contract after attending Detroit s development camp in July and playing for the club last week at the 2014 NHL Prospects Tournament in Traverse City, Mich. In 2013-14, Hicketts skated in 36 games for the Western Hockey League s Victoria Royals, ranking second among the team s defensemen with 24 points (6-18-24) despite missing nearly half the season due to injury. The 5-foot-8, 186-lb., blueliner has played 103 WHL games for the Royals since 2012-13, totaling 48 points (12-36-48), a plus-14 rating and 57 penalty minutes over two seasons. He has also appeared in 13 playoff games for the club, registering three assists and 11 penalty minutes.

A native of Kamloops, British Columbia, Hicketts has represented Canada twice on the international stage. He captained Team Pacific at the World Under-17 Hockey Challenge in Drummondville and Victoriaville, Quebec, in 2013 and won a bronze medal with Canada at the Under-18 World Championships in Lappeenranta and Imatra, Finland, in April 2014. Hicketts picked up a combined 10 points (2-8-10) and 12 penalty minutes over the two tournaments. #redwings
caption_raw:
The Detroit Red Wings today announced that they have agreed to terms with defenseman Joe Hicketts (@joehicketts) on a three-year, entry-level contract. In accordance with club policy, additional details will not be disclosed.

Hicketts, 18, signs his first NHL contract after attending Detroit’s development camp in July and playing for the club last week at the 2014 NHL Prospects Tournament in Traverse City, Mich. In 2013-14, Hicketts skated in 36 games for the Western Hockey League’s Victoria Royals, ranking second among the team’s defensemen with 24 points (6-18-24) despite missing nearly half the season due to injury. The 5-foot-8, 186-lb., blueliner has played 103 WHL games for the Royals since 2012-13, totaling 48 points (12-36-48), a plus-14 rating and 57 penalty minutes over two seasons. He has also appeared in 13 playoff games for the club, registering three assists and 11 penalty minutes.

A native of Kamloops, British Columbia, Hicketts has represented Canada twice on the international stage. He captained Team Pacific at the World Under-17 Hockey Challenge in Drummondville and Victoriaville, Quebec, in 2013 and won a bronze medal with Canada at the Under-18 World Championships in Lappeenranta and Imatra, Finland, in April 2014. Hicketts picked up a combined 10 points (2-8-10) and 12 penalty minutes over the two tournaments. #redwings

caption:
#Repost from @zetterbergfoundation --- Detroit Red Wings Captain Henrik Zetterberg and his wife Emma are hosting the First Annual Zetterberg Foundation Charity Event on September 12, 2014 at Tre Monti Ristorante in Troy. Join them, along with Henrik s Detroit Red Wings Captain Henrik Zetterberg and his wife Emma are hosting the First Annual Zetterberg Foundation Charity Event on September 12, 2014 at Tre Monti Ristorante in Troy. Join them, along with Henrik s teammates, in raising 
money for Zetterberg Foundation and the causes it supports. 
Zetterberg Foundation was established in 2013 by Henrik and Emma to increase and expand their efforts in giving back to the City of Detroit, and the charitable 
causes they believe in globally; involving children, education and healthcare.

Tickets for the event are $500 for VIP and $250 for General Admission. Only 50 VIP 
tickets will be sold. VIP ticket package includes entry to a private reception with 
Henrik, Emma and other Red Wings players from 6 to 7pm. General Admission ticket holders will join at 7pm. All will enjoy cocktails, dinner, live auction, and 
entertainment until midnight. 
Cocktail Attire   Must be 21 or older to attend

Event sponsors: Hour Media, Cauley Ferrari, Tapper s Diamonds and Fine Jewelry.

For tickets, visit https://zfcharityevent.eventbrite.com

caption: The Detroit Red Wings announced today that the team has signed executive vice president and general manager Ken Holland to a new four-year contract that will keep him with the organization through the 2017-18 season.  Ken is regarded as one of the premier executives in the National Hockey League and has been instrumental in the success of the Red Wings over the last two decades,  Red Wings owner Mike Ilitch said.  Marian and I are extremely pleased that he will continue to lead our hockey club over the next four years. We feel strongly that stability is key to the success of any organization and having this new agreement in place with Ken is important to the organization and its future.  #redwings
caption_raw: The Detroit Red Wings announced today that the team has signed executive vice president and general manager Ken Holland to a new four-year contract that will keep him with the organization through the 2017-18 season. “Ken is regarded as one of the premier executives in the National Hockey League and has been instrumental in the success of the Red Wings over the last two decades,” Red Wings owner Mike Ilitch said. “Marian and I are extremely pleased that he will continue to lead our hockey club over the next four years. We feel strongly that stability is key to the success of any organization and having this new agreement in place with Ken is important to the organization and its future.” #redwings

caption:
Tomas Tatar (@trto90) signs a new three-year deal with the #RedWings! 
Tatar, 23, completed his first full NHL season in 2013-14, ranking sixth on the team with 39 points (19-20-39) in 73 games. The 5-foot-10, 186-lb., forward also ranked among team leaders with 19 goals (2nd), a plus-12 rating (3rd), three game-winning goals (T4th), 158 shots (1st) and three shootout goals (1st). He also represented Slovakia at the 2014 Winter Olympics in Sochi, Russia, tying for second on the team with two points (1-1-2) in four games. Originally drafted by Detroit in the second round (60th overall) of the 2009 NHL Entry Draft, Tatar has skated in 100 career games with the Red Wings since 2010-11, tallying 47 points (24-23-47) and 34 penalty minutes. #tats

caption: Today the #RedWings have signed Landon Ferraro to a one-year deal. @lferraro29, 22, made his @NHL debut for the Red Wings on March 18, 2014, against Toronto and went on to skate in four games for Detroit. caption:
The Detroit Red Wings today signed goaltender Jonas Gustavsson to a one-year contract. In accordance with club policy, additional details will not be disclosed.

Gustavsson, 29, posted a 16-5-4 record in 27 appearances with the Red Wings during the 2013-14 campaign, along with a 2.63 goals-against average and a 0.907 save percentage. Last season, the 6-foot-3, 192-pound goaltender suffered only two regulation losses in his final 13 appearances (8-2-2) and won five-straight starts on two occasions (Nov. 21-Dec. 6, Dec. 19-Jan. 24). Gustavsson started the season on an 8-0-1 run and was named the NHL s First Star of the Week on Oct. 20 after posting a perfect 3-0-0 record with a 1.67 goals-against average and a 0.953 save percentage. Gustavsson also saw his first NHL playoff action last season, starting Games 4-5 against Boston in the opening round of the Stanley Cup Playoffs. #monster #redwings
caption_raw:

Last season, the 6-foot-3, 192-pound goaltender suffered only two regulation losses in his final 13 appearances (8-2-2) and won five-straight starts on two occasions (Nov. 21-Dec. 6, Dec. 19-Jan. 24). Gustavsson started the season on an 8-0-1 run and was named the NHL’s First Star of the Week on Oct. 20 after posting a perfect 3-0-0 record with a 1.67 goals-against average and a 0.953 save percentage. caption:
The  # RedWings  are set to stage 2014 training camp in Traverse City this September!

The NHL Prospects Tournament (9/12-9/16), Alumni and Celebrity Game (9/20), and main Training Camp (9/19-9/23) will be returning to Centre ICE Arena. 
Tickets for these events go on sale at Centre ICE Arena on July 7. Prices for practices are $10 for standing-room, $15 for reserved seating, and $20 for mezzanine. 
Tickets for the Red and White Game and Training Camp Alumni and Celebrity Game start at $20 for standing-room, $25 for reserved seating and $30 for mezzanine. Select 2014 training camp merch will also be available for purchase. 
For more information, call (231) 933-7465 or visit www.centreice.org.

MORE: http://redwings.nhl.com/club/news.htm?id=722814

caption: Congratulations to Tomas Tatar (@trto90) on winning TSN's 'Play of the Year' for his dazzling goal against the Dallas Stars! Tats beat out fellow teammate Gustav Nyquist and his ridiculous goal against Tampa Bay. This was the second year in a row we've had two Red Wings plays in the finals for this competition. Last year being, Datsyuk v. Datsyuk, yes he's that good. Thank you to all the fans who took the time to cast their votes again this year!

Mantha broke a 3-3 deadlock with 51 seconds remaining in regulation as the Val-d'Or Foreurs edged the host Baie-Comeau Drakkar 4-3 on Tuesday to win the Quebec Major Junior Hockey League championship. caption:
The opportunity to make moments like these happen is why we're in this business. Last night, Kelly Rothe, who's having a double mastectomy today at the age of 20, was invited down to Joe Louis Arena for a private dinner on the eve of her surgery. Little did she know the surprises that were waiting for her... to watch the full video visit video.redwings.nhl.com or youtube.com/officialredwings

On behalf of all of Hockeytown, we wish you nothing but the best and a speedy recovery! #RedWings #Howie

Special thanks to @kaleidoband for the music and @pinkandbluemovie for the additional footage!

caption: Q. Your first playoff game, now that you ve got that behind you, what your thoughts about the game? "It was really tough for my first playoff game, it was against the Bruins and they have a really good team, the game was really tight. I m glad I have it behind me and now we can re-focus for the next game and don t have to be as shaky and play with more confidence." - @trto90 after today's practice in Boston. #redwings
caption_raw: Q. Your first playoff game, now that you’ve got that behind you, what your thoughts about the game? "It was really tough for my first playoff game, it was against the Bruins and they have a really good team, the game was really tight. I’m glad I have it behind me and now we can re-focus for the next game and don’t have to be as shaky and play with more confidence." - @trto90 after today's practice in Boston. #redwings

caption: Q: What do you guys need to up the intensity because they are going to come at you desperate in Game Two? "They're going to come out with more speed and physicalness so we just have prepare for that, I think we played a solid game and a structured game in Game One, we have to keep doing that, just have to stay disciplined and keep working the puck down low and try and get in Rask s eyes and go from there." - @rsheahan15 after practice today in Boston. #redwings
caption_raw: Q: What do you guys need to up the intensity because they are going to come at you desperate in Game Two? "They're going to come out with more speed and physicalness so we just have prepare for that, I think we played a solid game and a structured game in Game One, we have to keep doing that, just have to stay disciplined and keep working the puck down low and try and get in Rask’s eyes and go from there." - @rsheahan15 after practice today in Boston. #redwings

caption: Q: How tight that game was played last night is that what you guys anticipated from this series? "It s going to be tight, I think both teams are really good. If you look at both team s systems is very effective, and they ve done so well this year, and I think we ve done very good for the amount of injuries we ve had. It s something we re going to try and keep playing our system. I think the biggest thing is turnovers, the team that has less turnovers is the team that will be victorious." - @bssmith2 after practice today in Boston. #redwings
caption_raw: Q: How tight that game was played last night is that what you guys anticipated from this series? "It’s going to be tight, I think both teams are really good. If you look at both team’s systems is very effective, and they’ve done so well this year, and I think we’ve done very good for the amount of injuries we’ve had. It’s something we’re going to try and keep playing our system. I think the biggest thing is turnovers, the team that has less turnovers is the team that will be victorious." - @bssmith2 after practice today in Boston. #redwings

caption: Q. Have some of the young guys re-energized you, seemed like you were smiling an awful lot today during practice? "I think at playoff time each and every year it s always enjoyable. One of the reason it s enjoyable is because your players are all in. Lots of times during the year, it s a grind for them and a grind for you, and thats just the way the NHL is. And the more depth and talent you have the easier it is cause you win everyday. With our group we have lots great kids, lots of good young players. I believe our team is going in the right direction and we see growth everyday and that s a positive thing. It s way easy to practice to after you win then after you lose, thats been that way always. That s why winning is so much fun." - Mike Babcock after practice today in Boston. #redwings

caption:
Q: Reilly said you guys won t be talking much? 
B. Smith: "We ve talked a little bit. We were actually going to try to get together last night but we had some team dinners so we opted out on that. We re still talking. He s always chirping back and forth so he ll get a rise out of you guys more than he ll get a rise out of me." Q. "Who do your parents root for?
B. Smith: I don t know if you guys saw Miller s mom had the Blues and the Red Wings. She s really crafty like that so she might do that. A bunch of the boys are like,  Hey, where are your parents staying? At Reilly s place? Yeah, all right. OK. So they re cheering for the Bruins.  We ll see what they do. It looks like they might have something creative where it might be half and half." - The #RedWings @bssmith2 before Game One against the @nhlbruins

It looks like they might have something creative where it might be half and half." - The #RedWings @bssmith2 before Game One against the @nhlbruins

caption:
Q: is energy of team due to focusing on present vs. past?

Babcock: "Well you know what, I don t know. We talk a lot about the past in the media, we never talk about the past in our dress. To me it s about the present, living right here, right now. We have a good group of kids, we have good veteran leadership, but our kids have played really well, giving us energy. They ve come here and they ve replaced people and they ve earned jobs. It s not like they re going back to the minors, they re not. They re here, they took jobs and they re going to keep jobs and this is a group we re going ahead with. Now obviously some of the guys that are injured, Zetterberg I m sure can still get a spot on the team. Ericsson, I m sure. That s just part if they re not here what are we going to do about it, let s play." - #RedWings Head Coach Mike Babcock before Game One against @nhlbruins

caption:
"For sure it s different than last year, I mean I expect it s going to be more physical, more emotional, it s going to be tough games, each game, each minute of the game will be really hard so it s going to be a little different than the regular season but it s still the same league so I can t be afraid of something. Just gotta play like I played before." Q: take anything from last year s AHL run?
Jurco: Yeah I mean it helped me a little bit for sure just to compete with men in the playoffs before I only played in the playoffs in juniors so it for sure helped me a little bit but like I said this is a little different so I m really excited." - @tomasjurco before Game One against @nhlbruins

caption:
The Detroit Red Wings today signed center Luke Glendening to a three-year contract extension. In accordance with club policy, additional details will not be disclosed.

Glendening, 24, has made 51 appearances with the Red Wings as a second-year pro, recording six points (0-6-6), 16 penalty minutes, 78 hits and 32 blocked shots, while averaging 13:49 of ice time. He has also skated in 18 games with the AHL s Grand Rapids Griffins this season, registering 12 points (5-7-12), a plus-8 rating and 18 penalty minutes. The Grand Rapids, Mich., native started his professional career in 2012-13 with the ECHL s Toledo Walleye, notching 21 points (14-7-21) in 27 games before moving up to the AHL full-time. In 51 games with his hometown Griffins, the 5-foot-11, 195-lb., forward tallied 26 points (8-18-26) and 50 penalty minutes. He also helped the team win its first-ever Calder Cup, tying for the AHL rookie lead in the postseason with 16 points (6-10-16) and 30 penalty minutes in 24 games.

A product of the University of Michigan, Glendening recorded 70 points (31-39-70) in 165 collegiate contests with the Wolverines from 2008-12. After initially making the team as a walk-on, he served as the team s captain as a junior and senior and won the CCHA s Best Defensive Forward award in 2011-12. #redwings

caption:
Congratulations to Gustav Nyquist on being named the second star of the month of March by @NHL!

Nyquist ranked second in the NHL with 12 goals and tied for fifth with 18 points to help the Red Wings go 7-6-2 and move into the first Wild Card spot in the Eastern Conference (35-26-14, 84 points). He found the back of the net in nine of 15 games, including a six-game goal streak March 16-25 (9-1 10), the longest by a Red Wings player since Daniel Cleary had an equal run Nov. 5-17, 2010 (8-2 10). Nyquist posted a career-high four points (1-3 4) March 7 vs. NJ and added three two-goal performances: March 18 vs. TOR, March 23 vs. MIN and March 25 at CBJ. He also chipped in his team-leading fifth game-winning goal of the season March 22 at MIN. The 24-year-old Halmstad, Sweden, native leads the League with 22 goals in 27 games since Jan. 20 and is currently on a nine-game point streak (11-2 13), the longest by a Red Wings player since Dec. 22, 2010-Jan. 10, 2011 (Henrik Zetterberg: 6-10 16 in 11 games). Playing in his third NHL season, all with the Red Wings, Nyquist leads the team with 27 goals and is tied for second with 45 points in 50 games. #nyquist #gooseisloose #redwings

caption:
#RedWings captain, Henrik Zetterberg, spoke with the media today for the first time since his successful back surgery.

Question: How are you feeling?
Zetterberg. Feeling much better thank you, obviously it was a struggle there for a bit, the last two weeks it s been much better

Question: For a competitor like you to see your team where they are right now, how difficult is to watch and not play?
Zetterberg: Well I m kinda jealous I m not in it, this is the best time of the year, you know we want to make the playoffs, playoffs is the best time of the year, we went through this last year too, the guys are doing a great job, they re battling, we know what we have to do, we have to win game, I don t like sitting and watching from the outside so the games are pretty tough and would rather be in playing.

Question: Looks like you ve got quite the start to the playoff beard, any chance you might appear in a playoff game?
Zetterberg: Well that the goal, I want to play hockey again this year and obviously that will be sometime around playoffs, so I thought I mine as well get a head start.

Full media interview is now live on www.detroitredwings.com & youtube.com/officialredwings #Zetterberg #zettybeard

caption:
The Detroit #RedWings today recalled left wing Mitch Callahan (@mcally15) from the AHL s Grand Rapids Griffins (@griffinshockey) and assigned center Landon Ferraro to the Griffins.

Callahan, 22, ranks among the Griffins  leaders with 25 goals (2nd), 40 points (3rd), a plus-21 rating (1st) 51 penalty minutes (5th), six power-play goals (T2nd), two shorthanded goals (1st) and 185 shots on goal (1st). The Whittier, Calif., native has skated in 185 games with Grand Rapids since 2011-12, recording 69 points (42-27-69) and 247 penalty minutes. Originally drafted in the sixth round (180th overall) by Detroit in the 2009 NHL Entry Draft, Callahan helped the Griffins to a Calder Cup championship in 2012-13, notching 20 points (11-9-20) in 71 regular-season games and 11 points (6-5-11) in 24 postseason contests. Prior to turning professional, the 6-foot, 195-lb., forward appeared in 204 WHL games with the Kelowna Rockets from 2008-11, tallying 128 points (57-71-128) and 440 penalty minutes. He was also a member of the 2009 Kelowna squad that captured the WHL s Ed Chynoweth Cup.

caption:
Congratulations to Gustav Nyquist on being named 'first star' of the week by the @NHL. 
Nyquist led all players with six goals and tied for the League lead with seven points to help the Red Wings (33-24-14, 80 points) earn seven of a possible eight points and move into the first Wild Card spot in the Eastern Conference. He opened the week with two goals in a 3-2 win over the  Toronto Maple Leafs March 18. Nyquist followed that up with 1-1 2, including the primary assist on  Daniel Alfredsson's last-second overtime winner, in a 5-4 triumph over the  Pittsburgh Penguins March 20. He then scored his fifth game-winning goal of the season in a 3 2 victory over the  Minnesota Wild March 22 and capped the week with 2-0 2, his fourth multi-goal game of the season, in a 4-3 overtime loss to the  Minnesota Wild March 23. The 24-year-old native of Halmstad, Sweden, has 23-17 40 in 46 games this season, including 7-1 8 during a five-game goal/point streak and a League-leading 18 goals in 23 games since Jan. 20.

caption:
#RedWings today recalled right wing Teemu Pulkkinen from the AHL s @griffinshockey 
Pulkkinen, 22, leads the Griffins and is tied for 13th in the AHL with 49 points (24-25-49) in 58 games this season. The winger paces all AHL rookies in goals and is currently second in the league in scoring among first-year players. The Vantaa, Finland, native appeared briefly with the Griffins last year after his season in Finland concluded, recording one assist in two regular-season games and five points (3-2-5) in 14 postseason contests. Pulkkinen skated in 185 career games with Jokerit of Finland s SM-Liiga from 2008-13, totaling 128 points (49-79-128). He was named the league s rookie of the year in 2010-11.

The Detroit #RedWings today recalled defenseman Ryan Sproul (@sproully93) from the AHL s @griffinshockey

Sproul, 21, leads all Griffins  rookies and sits second among AHL rookie blueliners with 24 points (8-16-24) in 53 games. He is also tied for fifth on the team with four power-play tallies and ranks fourth with 112 shots on goal. A native of Toronto, Ontario, Sproul played 172 games with the Sault Ste. Marie Greyhounds from 2010-13, recording 153 points (57-96-153) and 134 penalty minutes. He led all OHL defensemen in scoring last season, earning the league s Max Kaminsky Trophy as most outstanding defenseman as well as the CHL Defenseman of the Year award. The 6-foot-4, 205-pound defenseman was originally drafted by Detroit in the second round (55th overall) of the 2011 NHL Entry Draft.

caption:
The Detroit #RedWings today recalled defenseman Alexey Marchenko from the AHL s Grand Rapids Griffins.

Originally drafted by Detroit in the seventh round (205th overall) of the 2011 NHL Entry Draft, Marchenko has skated in 33 games with the Griffins this season, recording 16 points (2-14-16), six penalty minutes and a team-best plus-15 rating. The Moscow, Russia, native is in his first season in North America after spending parts of the last four seasons in the KHL. The 6-foot-2, 212-pound defenseman registered nine points (4-5-9) in 44 games with CSKA Moscow last season. In 82 career KHL games from 2009-13, he tallied 11 points (4-7-11) and 12 penalty minutes. The 22-year-old defenseman also racked up 78 points (18-60-78) for CSKA Moscow at Russia s junior level, capturing a league championship in 2010-11.
caption_raw:
The Detroit #RedWings today recalled defenseman Alexey Marchenko from the AHL’s Grand Rapids Griffins.

Originally drafted by Detroit in the seventh round (205th overall) of the 2011 NHL Entry Draft, Marchenko has skated in 33 games with the Griffins this season, recording 16 points (2-14-16), six penalty minutes and a team-best plus-15 rating. The Moscow, Russia, native is in his first season in North America after spending parts of the last four seasons in the KHL. The 6-foot-2, 212-pound defenseman registered nine points (4-5-9) in 44 games with CSKA Moscow last season. In 82 career KHL games from 2009-13, he tallied 11 points (4-7-11) and 12 penalty minutes. The 22-year-old defenseman also racked up 78 points (18-60-78) for CSKA Moscow at Russia’s junior level, capturing a league championship in 2010-11.

caption:
The Detroit #RedWings today recalled right wing Jordin Tootoo (@kudluk22)from the AHL s Grand Rapids Griffins. (@griffinshockey)

Tootoo, 30, has skated in 50 games with the Red Wings over the last two seasons, recording eight points (3-5-8) and 83 penalty minutes. In 536 career NHL contests since 2003-04, Tootoo has totaled 133 points (49-84-133) and 808 penalty minutes in 536 games between Nashville and Detroit. The Churchill, Manitoba, native has skated in 12 games with Grand Rapids since joining the team on Nov. 14, tallying four points (1-3-4) and 23 penalty minutes. He has appeared in 112 career AHL games with the Milwaukee Admirals and Griffins, registering 53 points (24-29-53) and 422 penalty minutes.

caption:
The Detroit #RedWings today recalled right wing Tomas Jurco (@tomasjurco) from the AHL s Grand Rapids Griffins (@griffinshockey). Jurco is expected to be in the lineup today as Detroit hosts Tampa Bay at 5 p.m. (FOX Sports Detroit PLUS/1270 AM). Jurco, 20, currently leads the Griffins and is tied for seventh in the American Hockey League with 27 points (11-16-27) in 26 games. In 74 games as a first-year pro in 2012-13, Jurco tallied 28 points (14-14-28), half of which (7-7-14) came in the final 22 games of the regular season. The 6-foot-2, 195-lb., forward helped lead the Griffins to their first-ever Calder Cup championship, recording 14 points (8-6-14) in 24 postseason games. His eight goals led all AHL rookies in the playoffs, while tying for sixth on the Griffins overall in scoring. He has 55 points (25-30-55) in 100 career games with Grand Rapids.

A native of Kosice, Slovakia, Jurco also helped the QMJHL s Saint John Sea Dogs to three straight finals appearances from 2009-12, winning the President s Cup as league champions in 2011 and 2012 and also capturing the CHL s Memorial Cup in 2011. Over his three-year major junior career, he recorded 175 points (87-88-175) in 172 regular-season games and 64 points (26-38-64) in 56 postseason contests. Jurco also represented Slovakia at the IIHF World Junior Championships, recording one point (1-0-1) in six games in 2011 and eight points (1-7-8) in 2012.

caption:
The Detroit #RedWings today recalled center Cory Emmerton from the AHL s Grand Rapids Griffins.

Originally drafted by Detroit in the second round (41st overall) of the 2006 NHL Entry Draft, Emmerton has appeared in four games with the Red Wings this season, registering one assist and seven shots on goal. He was assigned to Grand Rapids on Oct. 10 and has recorded 14 points (3-11-14) and 10 penalty minutes in 18 AHL games. A native of St. Thomas, Ontario, Emmerton has appeared in 125 career games with Detroit, notching 20 points (12-8-20) and 20 penalty minutes. In 235 games with the Griffins from 2006-13, the 25-year-old forward has tallied 125 points (37-88-125) and 76 penalty minutes.

caption:
The #RedWings today signed defenseman Jonathan Ericsson to a six-year contract extension. In accordance with club policy, additional details will not be disclosed.

Originally drafted by Detroit with the last pick (291st overall) of the 2002 NHL Entry Draft, Ericsson has played 292 games with the Red Wings since making his NHL debut in 2007-08. Over seven seasons with the organization, he has logged 62 points (14-48-62), a +14 rating and 242 penalty minutes. He has also posted 16 points (5-11-16), a +9 rating and 43 penalty minutes in 64 career postseason contests. This season, the 6-foot-4, 221-pound defenseman has tallied five points (1-4-5) and 16 penalty minutes in 15 games, while ranking second on the team with an average of 22:15 time on ice.

A native of Karlskrona, Sweden, Ericsson also recorded 63 points (15-48-63) and 185 penalty minutes in 136 games with the AHL s Grand Rapids Griffins from 2006-08. Prior to moving to North America, he skated in 81 contests with Sodertalje in the Swedish Elite League from 2003-06. #BigE #Ericsson ^DM

caption:
The Detroit Red Wings today agreed to terms with left wing Andreas Athanasiou on a three-year entry-level contract. In accordance with club policy, additional details will not be disclosed.

Athanasiou, 19, has appeared in 22 games with the OHL s Barrie Colts, leading the club with 26 points (9-17-26). A fourth-round pick (110th overall) of Detroit in the 2012 NHL Entry Draft, Athanasiou has appeared in 206 career OHL games with Barrie and London, totaling 152 points (71-81-152), a plus-27 rating and 103 penalty minutes. He was third on the Colts during the 2013 postseason with 25 points (12-13-25) in 22 games, reaching the OHL finals for the second straight year after winning a championship with the London Knights in 2011-12. #redwings #doublea ^DM

caption:
The #RedWings today recalled defenseman Adam Almquist from the AHL s Grand Rapids Griffins.

Originally drafted in the seventh round (210th overall) of the 2009 NHL Entry Draft, Almquist has skated in 10 games with the Griffins this season, tying for first among the team s defensemen with seven points (0-7-7). He helped the Griffins to their first-ever Calder Cup championship during his first season in North America in 2012-13, recording 31 points (10-21-31) in 68 regular-season games and 10 points (3-7-10) in 21 playoff games. The 5-foot-11, 173-lb. defenseman tied for the postseason lead in goals and ranked fifth in points among AHL blueliners.

A native of Huskvarna, Sweden, Almquist also spent three seasons with HV 71 in the Swedish Hockey League prior to joining Grand Rapids. He registered 35 points (5-30-35) in 122 games with the club from 2009-12 and captured the SHL championship in 2010, tying for first in the league among defensemen with 11 points (1-10-11) in 16 postseason contests.
caption_raw:
The #RedWings today recalled defenseman Adam Almquist from the AHL’s Grand Rapids Griffins.

Originally drafted in the seventh round (210th overall) of the 2009 NHL Entry Draft, Almquist has skated in 10 games with the Griffins this season, tying for first among the team’s defensemen with seven points (0-7-7). He helped the Griffins to their first-ever Calder Cup championship during his first season in North America in 2012-13, recording 31 points (10-21-31) in 68 regular-season games and 10 points (3-7-10) in 21 playoff games. The 5-foot-11, 173-lb. defenseman tied for the postseason lead in goals and ranked fifth in points among AHL blueliners.

A native of Huskvarna, Sweden, Almquist also spent three seasons with HV 71 in the Swedish Hockey League prior to joining Grand Rapids. He registered 35 points (5-30-35) in 122 games with the club from 2009-12 and captured the SHL championship in 2010, tying for first in the league among defensemen with 11 points (1-10-11) in 16 postseason contests.

caption:
The #RedWings today agreed to terms with right wing Zach Nastasiuk on a three-year entry-level contract. In accordance with club policy, additional details will not be disclosed.

A native of Barrie, Ontario, Nastasiuk was recently named captain of the OHL s Owen Sound Attack, where he stands second in team scoring with 18 points (8-10-18) in 16 games. Drafted by Detroit in the second round (48th overall) of the 2013 NHL Entry Draft, Nastasiuk has played 146 career games for the Attack, recording 77 points (39-38-77) and 55 penalty minutes. Last season, the 6-foot-2, 196-lb. forward recorded 40 points (20-20-40) in 62 regular-season games and a team-leading 11 points (4-7-11) in 12 postseason games. ^DM

caption: #RedWings Executive Vice President and General Manager Ken Holland today announced that the club has agreed to terms with defenseman Brendan Smith on a two-year deal. In accordance with team policy, additional terms of the deal will not be disclosed. Smith, 24, was selected by the Red Wings in the first round (27th overall) of the 2007 National Hockey League Entry Draft.  The 6-1, 199-lb. blueliner recently completed his first full season in Detroit. He skated in 34 regular season games for the Red Wings in 2012-13, posting eight points (0G-8A-8P) and 36 PIM.  Smith missed 11 games this year due to a shoulder injury and was a healthy scratch for three contests. In 48 career NHL games, he has posted 15 points (1G-14A-15P) and 49 PIM.  Smith also appeared in all 14 postseason games for Detroit this season, collecting five points (2G-3A-5P) and 10 PIM. Smith spent parts of the last three seasons with the Grand Rapids Griffins of the American Hockey League.  In 152 career AHL contests, he registered 86 points (27G-59A-86P) and 263 PIM.  Prior to joining the Griffins for the 2010-11 season, Smith spent three seasons at the University of Wisconsin (NCAA/WCHA) amassing 87 points (26G-61A-87P) in 95 collegiate appearances. (Dan Mannes/DRW)

(Dan Mannes/DRW)

caption: Gustav Nyquist has been named the 2012-13 Red Wings Rookie of the Year by the Detroit Sports Broadcasters Association (DSBA). Nyquist, 23, skated in 22 games for Detroit during the shortened 2012-13 season, collecting six points (3G-3A-6P), six PIM and an  even  rating.  He also appeared in all 14 postseason games for the Red Wings, notching five points (2G-3A-5P), a +3 rating and tallied his first career playoff goal in overtime of Game Two of the Western Conference Quarterfinals against the Anaheim Ducks.  I m really excited to be chosen as the DSBA Rookie of the Year,  said Nyquist.  There were a lot of candidates this year because so many young guys were called up and ended up playing pretty significant roles. When you look at some of the past winners of the award like Pavel Datsyuk, Henrik Zetterberg, Marcel Dionne, Glenn Hall and Terry Sawchuk, it s really a great honor.  #nyquist #goose #redwings (Dan Mannes/DRW)
caption_raw: Gustav Nyquist has been named the 2012-13 Red Wings Rookie of the Year by the Detroit Sports Broadcasters Association (DSBA). Nyquist, 23, skated in 22 games for Detroit during the shortened 2012-13 season, collecting six points (3G-3A-6P), six PIM and an ‘even’ rating.  He also appeared in all 14 postseason games for the Red Wings, notching five points (2G-3A-5P), a +3 rating and tallied his first career playoff goal in overtime of Game Two of the Western Conference Quarterfinals against the Anaheim Ducks. “I’m really excited to be chosen as the DSBA Rookie of the Year,” said Nyquist. “There were a lot of candidates this year because so many young guys were called up and ended up playing pretty significant roles. When you look at some of the past winners of the award like Pavel Datsyuk, Henrik Zetterberg, Marcel Dionne, Glenn Hall and Terry Sawchuk, it’s really a great honor.” #nyquist #goose #redwings (Dan Mannes/DRW)
