caption: We just gotta get back to it. In Anaheim series, we had to win the last two games there and we did so hopefully we can get a win in Chicago as well. We won there earlier in the series so we know we can do it.  Joakim Andersson #redwings (Dan Mannes/DRW)

caption: We beat a really good team in Anaheim on the road. I think these guys create the same challenge for us, being in that moment already   guys should remember that feeling. We ve had guys in this room who have won Stanley Cups. We like our chances.  - Carlo Colaiacovo #redwings (Dan Mannes/DRW)

caption: "They got what we gave them tonight...period. If I would have told our whole team before this series, if I would have told Detroit, Michigan before this series that we were going to be playing Chicago in Game Seven I think everyone would have been pretty excited about that...I love Game Sevens... I'm excited about it...we have a chance to push them out of the playoffs. Should be a lot of fun." - Mike Babcock following tonight's Game Six loss. (Dave Reginek/DRW)

caption:
"I don't think there's an obligation to win like a Red Wing, I think there's an obligation to prepare for the opportunity you're given, to compete for what you've been given, and to maximize your potential. I think that's what life's about, maximizing what you've been given."
- Mike Babcock before Game Four (Dave Reginek/DRW)

"I don't think there's an obligation to win like a Red Wing, I think there's an obligation to prepare for the opportunity you're given, to compete for what you've been given, and to maximize your potential. I think that's what life's about, maximizing what you've been given."
- Mike Babcock before Game Four (Dave Reginek/DRW)

It s something that we re looking forward to tomorrow night.  - Kronwall #redwings

caption:
#ThrowbackThursday | Red Berenson | Detroit Red Wings 1970-1975 - University of Michigan head coach 1984-Present | 
Red returned to his Alma Mater as Head Coach in 1984 and has remained in the position ever since. Berenson has led the Wolverines to 11 Frozen Four appearances, and NCAA championships in 1996 and 1998. In CCHA competition, his teams have won 11 regular-season and 9 tournament titles, and the Wolverines have secured a winning record since Berenson's second year at the helm. In addition, Berenson's squads have qualified for the NCAA Tournament in each of the last 21 seasons. This is the longest streak ever in college hockey history. The Wolverines have also won 13 Great Lakes Invitational titles under Berenson. Speaking of GLI, did you get your tickets for this weeks exciting college hockey action? Call the box-office at 313-396-7575 #redwings #GLI

caption:
Fifty-two years ago today, Nov. 27, 1960, Gordie Howe went where no NHL player had gone before.
Howe entered the Detroit Red Wings' game against the Toronto Maple Leafs at the Olympia needing one point to become the first NHL player to record 1,000 regular-season points. He needed 6:36 to get it -- Howe assisted on a goal by Fred Glover that gave the Red Wings a 1-0 lead in a game they went on to win 2-0.
Howe's 1,000th point came in his 938th NHL game. He went on to add 850 points (including an assist on the Red Wings' other goal that night) and finished his NHL career 20 years later with 1,850 points, a total later passed by Wayne Gretzky and Mark Messier. #redwings #gordie #howe #9
caption_raw:
Fifty-two years ago today, Nov. 27, 1960, Gordie Howe went where no NHL player had gone before.
Howe entered the Detroit Red Wings' game against the Toronto Maple Leafs at the Olympia needing one point to become the first NHL player to record 1,000 regular-season points. He needed 6:36 to get it -- Howe assisted on a goal by Fred Glover that gave the Red Wings a 1-0 lead in a game they went on to win 2-0.
Howe's 1,000th point came in his 938th NHL game. He went on to add 850 points (including an assist on the Red Wings' other goal that night) and finished his NHL career 20 years later with 1,850 points, a total later passed by Wayne Gretzky and Mark Messier. #redwings #gordie #howe #9

caption:
The Detroit Red Wings will hold a special  Relive the Rivalry  viewing party at PB s Sports Grille in St. Clair Shores (24301 Harper Ave.) on Wednesday, November 28. Festivities will begin at 6:30 p.m. with Detroit s unforgettable sudden-death victory over Colorado from March 26, 1997 set to be shown in its entirety beginning at 7:30 p.m. Arguably the peak of the teams  epic 1990 s rivalry, the Red Wings and Avalanche combined to produce 11 goals and record 148 penalty minutes in this game.

Overtime hero Darren McCarty will be on hand to mingle with event patrons throughout the night. The  Grind Line  member will also sign autographs for fans and engage in an interactive Q&A session about the memorable Hockeytown showdown that featured some of the greatest players in recent NHL history. Hosted by Red Wings play-by-play announcer Ken Kal, this event is open to fans of all ages.
caption_raw:
The Detroit Red Wings will hold a special ‘Relive the Rivalry’ viewing party at PB’s Sports Grille in St. Clair Shores (24301 Harper Ave.) on Wednesday, November 28. Festivities will begin at 6:30 p.m. with Detroit’s unforgettable sudden-death victory over Colorado from March 26, 1997 set to be shown in its entirety beginning at 7:30 p.m. Arguably the peak of the teams’ epic 1990’s rivalry, the Red Wings and Avalanche combined to produce 11 goals and record 148 penalty minutes in this game.

Overtime hero Darren McCarty will be on hand to mingle with event patrons throughout the night. The ‘Grind Line’ member will also sign autographs for fans and engage in an interactive Q&A session about the memorable Hockeytown showdown that featured some of the greatest players in recent NHL history. Hosted by Red Wings play-by-play announcer Ken Kal, this event is open to fans of all ages.

caption: Valtteri Filppula helps kick off the new school with the Detroit Red Wings 'School Assembly Program' at St. Thecla Elementary School in Clinton Township, Mich. The assembly was a huge hit and everyone had a blast. #redwings #filppula #schoolassemblyprogram
caption_raw: Valtteri Filppula helps kick off the new school with the Detroit Red Wings 'School Assembly Program' at St. Thecla Elementary School in Clinton Township, Mich. The assembly was a huge hit and everyone had a blast. #redwings #filppula #schoolassemblyprogram

caption: Back To School With Val | Detroit Red Wings forward Valtteri Filppula will visit St. Thecla Elementary School in Clinton Township, Michigan today to drop the puck for the third year of the Red Wings School Assembly Program sponsored by the Detroit Red Wings Foundation, Blue Cross Blue Shield of Michigan and The Kroger Company of Michigan. Filppula and the Red Wings School Assembly Team will introduce 420 elementary students to the sport of hockey through a youth street and floor hockey initiative. The Wings will provide equipment and hands-on instruction to familiarize kids with the sport of hockey and to encourage an active and healthy lifestyle. This season, the Red Wings School Assembly Team plans to make 115 appearances throughout Michigan. #redwings #filppula #schoolassemblyprogram
caption_raw: Back To School With Val | Detroit Red Wings forward Valtteri Filppula will visit St. Thecla Elementary School in Clinton Township, Michigan today to drop the puck for the third year of the Red Wings School Assembly Program sponsored by the Detroit Red Wings Foundation, Blue Cross Blue Shield of Michigan and The Kroger Company of Michigan. Filppula and the Red Wings School Assembly Team will introduce 420 elementary students to the sport of hockey through a youth street and floor hockey initiative. The Wings will provide equipment and hands-on instruction to familiarize kids with the sport of hockey and to encourage an active and healthy lifestyle. This season, the Red Wings School Assembly Team plans to make 115 appearances throughout Michigan. #redwings #filppula #schoolassemblyprogram

caption:
Henrik Zetterberg launches Royal Swedish Snowballs, a traditional Swedish treat, in North America at an appearance at Just Baked in
Royal Oak, Michigan. At just 70-calories per serving, snowballs can be devoured without body-checking your diet into the end boards. Also, a portion of each sale will benefit the Zetterberg Foundation, which hosts patients from Detroit area children s hospitals, and their families, at Red Wings  home games. Royal Swedish Snowballs will be
available at all 12 metro Detroit Just Baked locations. The desserts
will be sold in 4-packs and 6-packs, and retail for $5.99 and $8.99, respectively.#royalswedishsnowballs #Zetterberg #RedWings
caption_raw:
Henrik Zetterberg launches Royal Swedish Snowballs, a traditional Swedish treat, in North America at an appearance at Just Baked in
Royal Oak, Michigan. At just 70-calories per serving, snowballs can be devoured without body-checking your diet into the end boards. Also, a portion of each sale will benefit the Zetterberg Foundation, which hosts patients from Detroit area children’s hospitals, and their families, at Red Wings’ home games. Royal Swedish Snowballs will be
available at all 12 metro Detroit Just Baked locations. The desserts
will be sold in 4-packs and 6-packs, and retail for $5.99 and $8.99, respectively.#royalswedishsnowballs #Zetterberg #RedWings

caption: The Detroit Red Wings  today announced the addition of three players who will participate in the festivities surrounding the 2012 Maple Leafs vs. Red Wings Alumni Showdown  on December 31 at Comerica Park  as part of the 2012 SiriusXM Hockeytown Winter Festival . Detroit has added defensemen Paul Coffey and Mathieu Dandenault as well as forward Martin Lapointe; all three players were members of the Red Wings during the team s record-setting campaign of 1995-96 during which Detroit won a total of 62 games   still the highest single-season total in NHL history. #redwings #winterclassic #alumnishowdown
caption_raw: The Detroit Red Wings® today announced the addition of three players who will participate in the festivities surrounding the 2012 Maple Leafs vs. Red Wings Alumni Showdown™ on December 31 at Comerica Park™ as part of the 2012 SiriusXM Hockeytown Winter Festival™. Detroit has added defensemen Paul Coffey and Mathieu Dandenault as well as forward Martin Lapointe; all three players were members of the Red Wings during the team’s record-setting campaign of 1995-96 during which Detroit won a total of 62 games – still the highest single-season total in NHL history. #redwings #winterclassic #alumnishowdown
